title: Algorithm
description: A step-by-step procedure or set of rules to solve a specific problem or perform a computation.

title: Binary
description: A numbering system that consists of only two digits, 0 and 1, used internally by almost all modern computers and computer-based devices.

title: Cache
description: A hardware or software component that stores data so that future requests for that data can be served faster.

title: Database
description: An organized collection of data, generally stored and accessed electronically from a computer system.

title: Encryption
description: The process of converting information or data into a code, especially to prevent unauthorized access.

title: Firewall
description: A network security system that monitors and controls incoming and outgoing network traffic based on predetermined security rules.

title: Gateway
description: A piece of networking hardware or software that allows data to flow from one discrete network to another.

title: Hash
description: The output of a hash function, which maps data of arbitrary size to fixed-size values, often used in data structures like hash tables.

title: Index
description: A data structure that improves the speed of data retrieval operations on a database table at the cost of additional space and decreased performance on data modification operations.

title: JavaScript
description: A high-level, often just-in-time compiled, and multi-paradigm programming language that conforms to the ECMAScript specification.
